by
February 12, 2025
Source: YouTube

"A movie rooted in small-town American rage." Yep it definitely seems like it. Decal Releasing has unveiled an official trailer for a psychological thriller film titled McVeigh, yes indeed about the notorious domestic terrorist Timothy McVeigh. Not sure why we need this film right now? Or ever? McVeigh is directed by indie filmmaker Mike Ott, and it first premiered at the 2024 Tribeca Film Festival last year - it's next available to watch in March. A haunting psychological thriller based on one of America's most infamous figures. After the Waco siege, a chilling plan brews in the mind of army veteran Timothy McVeigh. What follows are the harrowing events leading up to the single deadliest act of domestic terrorism in U.S. history - the Oklahoma City federal building bombing in 1995. Starring Alfie Allen as Tim, Brett Gelman, Tracy Letts, Ashley Benson, and Anthony Carrigan. There was a movie just few years ago about the Unabomber titled Ted K. This looks especially unsettling but not sure that's the kind of feeling I want to have during a film nowadays.

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Mike Ott's thriller film McVeigh, direct from YouTube:

A haunting psychological thriller based on one of America's most infamous figures. After the Waco siege, a chilling plan brews in the mind of army veteran Timothy McVeigh (starring Alfie Allen). What follows are the harrowing real-life events of the deadliest act of domestic terrorism in American history. McVeigh is directed by American indie filmmaker Mike Ott, director of the other indie films Analog Days, Littlerock, Pearblossom Hwy, Lake Los Angeles, Actor Martinez, and California Dreams previously, plus short films and a few TV series recently. The screenplay is written by Mike Ott & Alex Gioulakis. It's produced by Miles Alva, Nicolaas Bertelsen, Ash Christian, Joe Pirro, Shaum S. Sengupta, Monte Zajice. This first premiered at the 2024 Tribeca Film Festival last year along with a few other fests. Decal Releasing debuts Ott's McVeigh film in select US theaters + on VOD starting March 21st, 2025 coming soon. Is anyone curious to watch?
